title: Grilled Chicken Salad
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush chicken breasts with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing it into strips.
In a large bowl, combine salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese.
Top the salad with grilled chicken strips.
Drizzle balsamic vinaigrette dressing over the salad.
Toss gently to combine all ingredients.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: In a wok or large pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tofu cubes and stir-fry until golden brown.
Add broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, and snow peas. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour soy sauce and sesame oil over the vegetables. Toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve over rice or noodles. Enjoy!

title: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in carrots, celery, red wine, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, and basil.
Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Serve Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti.
Top with grated parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

title: Mango Salsa Chicken
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and ground cumin.
Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through.
In a bowl, combine diced mangoes, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeño, and fresh cilantro.
Drizzle lime juice and olive oil over the mango salsa. Toss to combine.
Serve grilled chicken topped with mango salsa.
Garnish with additional cilantro if desired. Enjoy!

title: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook penne pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add zucchini, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, carrot, and snap peas. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add cooked pasta to the pan. Toss to combine with the vegetables.
Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the pasta.
Garnish with fresh basil. Serve warm. Enjoy!

title: Honey Garlic Glazed Salmon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, olive oil, minced garlic, ginger, and rice vinegar.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush the salmon with the honey garlic glaze, reserving some for later.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Drizzle the remaining glaze over the cooked salmon.
Sprinkle sesame seeds and chopped green onions for garnish.
Serve with your favorite side dishes. Enjoy!

title: Caprese Salad
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter.
Drizzle balsamic glaze and olive oil over the slices.
Sprinkle with fresh basil leaves.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing salad or appetizer. Enjoy!

title: Chicken Fajitas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, mix olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Slice chicken thighs into strips and coat them in the spice mixture.
Spread chicken strips, sliced bell peppers, and onion on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Warm flour tortillas in the oven.
Serve chicken fajitas in warm tortillas with a dollop of sour cream. Enjoy!

title: Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Rinse quinoa under cold water. Combine quinoa and vegetable broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes or until quinoa is cooked.
In a bowl, toss diced zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and red onion with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dried thyme, rosemary, and garlic powder.
Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, roasted vegetables, and crumbled feta cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm or chilled. Enjoy!

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until garlic is fragrant.
Add shrimp to the pan and cook until pink and opaque.
Deglaze the pan with white wine. Add lemon zest and juice.
Toss in cooked pasta and fresh parsley. Mix until well coated.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve with a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

title: Teriyaki Tofu Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch.
Press tofu to remove excess water, then cut it into cubes.
In a wok or large pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add tofu cubes and stir-fry until golden brown.
Add broccoli, bell peppers, and snap peas. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and vegetables. Toss to coat evenly.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve over rice or noodles. Enjoy!

title: Roasted Lemon Herb Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, mix together olive oil, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Place chicken thighs on a baking sheet. Rub the herb mixture over the chicken.
Arrange lemon slices around the chicken on the baking sheet.
In a bowl, toss quartered potatoes, chopped carrots, and trimmed green beans with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetable mixture around the chicken on the baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve the roasted lemon herb chicken with the roasted vegetables. Enjoy!

title: Black Bean and Corn Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine black beans, thawed corn, diced red bell pepper, diced yellow bell pepper, and finely chopped red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil and lime juice to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Gently fold in chopped fresh cilantro and diced avocado.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve chilled as a refreshing salad or as a side dish. Enjoy!

title: Chicken and Vegetable Skewers

ingredients.name: red bell pepper, cut into chunks
green bell pepper, cut into chunks
yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks

instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Cut chicken breasts into bite-sized cubes.
In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, paprika, ground cumin, and dried oregano.
Thread chicken cubes, bell pepper chunks, and red onion onto the soaked wooden skewers.
Brush the skewers with the marinade.
Grill the skewers for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve the chicken and vegetable skewers hot off the grill. Enjoy!
